abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fifth Rubber
            Development Project for Cote d'Ivoire was satisfactory.
            The project achieved its objectives, institutional
            development was partially achieved, sustainability is
            likely, and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower
            was satisfactory. Two main lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, support pricing mechanisms for an export
            commodity are difficult to sustain over an extended period,
            particularly when competitiveness is affected by exchange
            rate maladjustment. This can lead to a debilitating impact
            on the institutions that finance the expansion of
            cultivation of such crops. Second, the structured nature of
            the process for World Bank financing may create
            disadvantages for executing agencies which desire to
            implement the project expeditiously.
